column5: Not mentioned anywhere except in Data Paper Instructions

They say it depends on the type of code - it is required upon acceptance when "This policy applies to submissions that include scripts for novel analyses, new methodologies, and for simulations. We do not require authors to make code available when used for standard analyses, creating figures or anything that does not affect the reproducibility of the results."
Only mentioned for "data papers", but still not mandated
For Ecology, data and code archiving remains optional with the exception of “Data Papers” (data required) and “Statistical Reports” (code required).
unclear if this is a journal

column4: proceedings of the national academy of sciences: usa
column5: A statment of data sharing plans is required for submission. All materials must be avaiable for editors and reviewers during peer review. All materials need to be stored in a community-approved public repositories prior to publication.

column6: Same statement includes data and code
Please ignore my comment on duplicate pages, I didn't see they were for data AND code haha.
